page.title: 07Water Sports and facilities
page.content: There is a Day Sailing Centre on the side of the Whitwell inlet of Rutland Water . Here dinghies and sailboards may be hired, launched and parked for a small fee. The Centre if fully equipped with changing rooms, showers and toilets. Sailors can bring their own boats. A warden is on duty and Water Safety rules are strict. Sailboarding is growing very popular and over 100 can be seen here on summer weekends. There is a sailboard simulator on dry land for beginners. Also at weekends a Sub Aqua Club and the Rutland Canoe Club operate from here. In November 1985 a new passenger cruiser was launched to take tourists for sightseeing trips around the water. The Peter Fry Trust provides rescue and first aid facilities.
